title: An Azure App Configuration Feature Declaration

id.title: Feature ID
id.description: An ID used to uniquely identify and reference the feature.

description.title: Feature Description
examples: This will display a fancy background on the home page.

display_name.title: Feature Display Name
display_name.description: A display name for the feature to use for display rather than the ID.

enabled.title: Enabled State
enabled.description: A feature is OFF if enabled is false. If enabled is true, then the feature is ON if there are no conditions (null or empty) or if the conditions are satisfied.

conditions.title: Feature Enablement Conditions
conditions.description: The declaration of conditions used to dynamically enable the feature

requirement_type.title: Requirement Type
requirement_type.description: Determines whether any or all registered client filters must be evaluated as true for the feature to be considered enabled.

client_filters.title: Client Filter Collection
client_filters.description: Filters that must run on the client and be evaluated as true for the feature to be considered enabled.

name.title: Client Filter Name
name.description: The name used to refer to a client filter.

parameters.title: Client Filter Parameters
parameters.description: Parameters for a given client filter. A client filter can require any set of parameters of any type.

variants.title: Variant Collection
variants.description: The list of variants defined for this feature. A variant represents a configuration value of a feature flag that can be a string, a number, a boolean, or a JSON object.

name.title: Variant Name
name.description: The name used to refer to a feature variant.

configuration_value.title: Variant Configuration Value
configuration_value.description: The configuration value for this feature variant.

configuration_reference.title: Variant Configuration Reference
configuration_reference.description: The path to a configuration section used as the configuration value for this feature variant.

status_override.title: Variant Status Override
status_override.description: Overrides the enabled state of the feature if the given variant is assigned. Does not override the state if value is None.

allocation.title: Variant Allocation
allocation.description: Determines how variants should be allocated for the feature to various users.

default_when_disabled.title: Default Variant Allocation When Disabled
default_when_disabled.description: Specifies which variant should be used when the feature is considered disabled.

default_when_enabled.title: Default Variant Allocation When Enabled
default_when_enabled.description: Specifies which variant should be used when the feature is considered enabled and no other allocation rules are applicable.

user.title: User Allocation Collection
user.description: A list of objects, each containing a variant name and list of users for whom that variant should be used.

variant.title: User Allocation Variant
variant.description: The name of the variant to use if the user allocation matches the current user.

users.title: User Allocation Users Collection
users.description: Collection of users where if any match the current user, the variant specified in the user allocation is used.

group.title: Group Allocation Collection
group.description: A list of objects, each containing a variant name and list of groups for which that variant should be used.

variant.title: Group Allocation Variant
variant.description: The name of the variant to use if the group allocation matches a group the current user is in.

groups.title: Group Allocation Groups Collection
groups.description: Collection of groups where if the current user is in any of these groups, the variant specified in the group allocation is used.

percentile.title: Percentile Allocation Collection
percentile.description: A list of objects, each containing a variant name and percentage range for which that variant should be used.

variant.title: Percentile Allocation Variant
variant.description: The name of the variant to use if the calculated percentile for the current user falls in the provided range.

from.title: Percentile Allocation From
from.description: The lower end of the percentage range for which this variant will be used.

to.title: Percentile Allocation To
to.description: The upper end of the percentage range for which this variant will be used.

seed.title: Percentile Allocation Seed
seed.description: The value percentile calculations are based on. The calculated percentile is consistent across features for a given user if the same nonempty seed is used.

telemetry.title: Telemetry Options
telemetry.description: The declaration of options used to configure telemetry for this feature.

metadata.title: Telemetry Metadata
metadata.description: A container for metadata that should be bundled with flag telemetry.
